trans-unit.source: Manage Windows Store for Business apps | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage Windows Store for Business apps | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Connect Microsoft Intune to the Windows Store for Business if you want to manage and deploy volume-purchased apps from the Intune console
trans-unit.target: Connect Microsoft Intune to the Windows Store for Business if you want to manage and deploy volume-purchased apps from the Intune console

trans-unit.source: Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage apps you purchased from the Windows Store for Business with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: The [Windows Store for Business](https://www.microsoft.com/business-store) gives you a place to find and purchase apps for your organization, individually, or in volume.
trans-unit.target: The [Windows Store for Business](https://www.microsoft.com/business-store) gives you a place to find and purchase apps for your organization, individually, or in volume.

trans-unit.source: By connecting the store to Microsoft Intune, you can manage volume-purchased apps from the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: By connecting the store to Microsoft Intune, you can manage volume-purchased apps from the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: You can synchronize the list of apps you have purchased from the store with Intune.
trans-unit.target: You can synchronize the list of apps you have purchased from the store with Intune.

trans-unit.source: Apps that are synchronized appear in the Intune administration console, and you can deploy these like any other apps.
trans-unit.target: Apps that are synchronized appear in the Intune administration console, and you can deploy these like any other apps.

trans-unit.source: You can track how many licenses are available, and how many are being used in the Intune administration console.
trans-unit.target: You can track how many licenses are available, and how many are being used in the Intune administration console.

trans-unit.source: Intune blocks deployment and installation of apps if there are an insufficient number of licenses available.
trans-unit.target: Intune blocks deployment and installation of apps if there are an insufficient number of licenses available.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: Review the following information before you start syncing and deploying apps from the Windows Store for Business:
trans-unit.target: Review the following information before you start syncing and deploying apps from the Windows Store for Business:

trans-unit.source: You must configure Intune as the mobile device management authority for your organization.
trans-unit.target: You must configure Intune as the mobile device management authority for your organization.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune](get-ready-to-enroll-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: You must have signed up for an account on the Windows Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: You must have signed up for an account on the Windows Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: Once you have associated a Windows Business Store account with Intune, you cannot change to a different account in the future.
trans-unit.target: Once you have associated a Windows Business Store account with Intune, you cannot change to a different account in the future.

trans-unit.source: Apps purchased from the store cannot be manually added to or deleted from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Apps purchased from the store cannot be manually added to or deleted from Intune.

trans-unit.source: They can only be synchronized with the Windows Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: They can only be synchronized with the Windows Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: Intune synchronizes only online licensed apps you have purchased from the Windows Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: Intune synchronizes only online licensed apps you have purchased from the Windows Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: Devices must be joined to Active Directory Domain Services, or workplace-joined, to use this capability.
trans-unit.target: Devices must be joined to Active Directory Domain Services, or workplace-joined, to use this capability.

trans-unit.source: Enrolled devices must be using the 1511 release of Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Enrolled devices must be using the 1511 release of Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Associate your Windows Store for Business account with Intune
trans-unit.target: Associate your Windows Store for Business account with Intune

trans-unit.source: Before you enable synchronization in the Intune console, you must configure your store account to use Intune as a management tool:
trans-unit.target: Before you enable synchronization in the Intune console, you must configure your store account to use Intune as a management tool:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you sign into the Business Store using the same tenant account you use to sign into Intune.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you sign into the Business Store using the same tenant account you use to sign into Intune.

trans-unit.source: In the Business Store, choose **Settings** > **Management tools**.
trans-unit.target: In the Business Store, choose **Settings** > **Management tools**.

trans-unit.source: On the Management tools page, choose **Add a management tool**, and choose **Microsoft Intune**.
trans-unit.target: On the Management tools page, choose **Add a management tool**, and choose **Microsoft Intune**.

trans-unit.source: You can now continue, and set up synchronization in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: You can now continue, and set up synchronization in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Configure synchronization
trans-unit.target: Configure synchronization

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Administration** workspace, expand **Mobile Device Management**, and then choose **Store for Business**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Administration** workspace, expand **Mobile Device Management**, and then choose **Store for Business**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Windows Store for Business** page, do the following:
trans-unit.target: On the **Windows Store for Business** page, do the following:

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, click the link to sign-up for the Windows Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, click the link to sign-up for the Windows Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: Once you are signed-up, choose **Configure Sync**.
trans-unit.target: Once you are signed-up, choose **Configure Sync**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configure Windows Store for Business app sync** dialog box, select **Enable Windows Store for Business sync**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configure Windows Store for Business app sync** dialog box, select **Enable Windows Store for Business sync**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Language** drop-down list, choose the language in which apps from the Windows Store for Business will be displayed in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: From the **Language** drop-down list, choose the language in which apps from the Windows Store for Business will be displayed in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of the language in which they are displayed, they will be installed in the end user's language when available.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of the language in which they are displayed, they will be installed in the end user's language when available.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Synchronize apps
trans-unit.target: Synchronize apps

trans-unit.source: On the **Windows Store for Business** page, choose **Sync now** to synchronize the apps you've purchased from the store with Intune.
trans-unit.target: On the **Windows Store for Business** page, choose **Sync now** to synchronize the apps you've purchased from the store with Intune.

trans-unit.source: In the **Apps** workspace, choose **Managed Software** > **Licensed Software** to view the available apps, and to verify that your purchased apps were imported correctly.
trans-unit.target: In the **Apps** workspace, choose **Managed Software** > **Licensed Software** to view the available apps, and to verify that your purchased apps were imported correctly.

trans-unit.source: The apps in this node are displayed with the total number of licenses you own, and the number of licenses you have available.
trans-unit.target: The apps in this node are displayed with the total number of licenses you own, and the number of licenses you have available.

trans-unit.source: Deploy apps
trans-unit.target: Deploy apps

trans-unit.source: You deploy apps from the store in the same way you deploy any other Intune app.
trans-unit.target: You deploy apps from the store in the same way you deploy any other Intune app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a Windows Store for Business app, a license is used by each user who installs the app.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a Windows Store for Business app, a license is used by each user who installs the app.

trans-unit.source: If you use all of the available licenses for a deployed app, you will not be able to deploy any more copies.
trans-unit.target: If you use all of the available licenses for a deployed app, you will not be able to deploy any more copies.

trans-unit.source: You must take one of the following actions:
trans-unit.target: You must take one of the following actions:

trans-unit.source: Uninstall the app from some devices.
trans-unit.target: Uninstall the app from some devices.

trans-unit.source: Reduce the scope of the current deployment to target only the users you have sufficient licenses for.
trans-unit.target: Reduce the scope of the current deployment to target only the users you have sufficient licenses for.

trans-unit.source: Buy more copies of the app from the Windows Store for Business.
trans-unit.target: Buy more copies of the app from the Windows Store for Business.

trans-unit.source: Deployed apps are only available to the user who originally enrolled the device.
trans-unit.target: Deployed apps are only available to the user who originally enrolled the device.

trans-unit.source: No other users can access the app.
trans-unit.target: No other users can access the app.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Add apps for mobile devices in Microsoft Intune](add-apps-for-mobile-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Add apps for mobile devices in Microsoft Intune](add-apps-for-mobile-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md)
